name: Fishtail Bar & Restaurant - Best Bar In Vagator Beach Goa

reviews.review_text:
Updated review

Your shack might look great, but the food and service were absolutely terrible. Here's the reality you need to face:

- The food was inedible‚Äîvegetarian items were stinking, the salad was stale, and the overall quality was shockingly bad.

- The service was the worst‚Äîyour staff didn‚Äôt listen to any of the concerns we raised and acted completely uninterested in resolving them.

Despite pointing out the issues to your waiter, we were ignored. Instead of addressing the situation, we were handed a ‚Çπ2800 bill without so much as an apology or any consideration for the poor experience.

What‚Äôs even worse is your attitude. You seem to think that anyone posting a negative review about your shack doesn‚Äôt understand food quality or service standards. That mindset is a bigger problem than the bad food or untrained staff. No tourist is out to tarnish your reputation‚Äîwe‚Äôre just sharing honest feedback based on what we experienced.
Goa thrives on tourism, and bad experiences like this affect not just your business but also the overall reputation of the local hospitality industry. An average tourist spends ‚Çπ70,000 on their trip‚Äîif they leave with memories like this, it‚Äôs unlikely they‚Äôll return or recommend your place to others.

If you care about your shack‚Äôs future, you need to take feedback like this seriously. Improve your food quality, train your staff to actually listen to guests, and stop blaming your customers for pointing out the truth.

Deflecting with responses or brushing off reviews won‚Äôt fix the very real issues with your service.

Beautiful place with one of the best sunset views in Goa ‚òÄÔ∏è. We had the Fish Goan Thali and the Fish Indian Thai to share. We were not disappointed üëå. So many flavours, textures, smells and everything tasted delicious.

Washed down with an orange, pineapple and ginger juice and a watermelon juice, all for under 1800 INR while watching the sun setting.

Quick friendly service too. You can't ask for more.

Visited for lunch.

One of the busy Restobar in Goa.
Vagator beach.

Had Goan Thali.
Food was incredible. Quantity was also sufficient.
King Fish fry was delicious and Goan fish curry was just yummy.

We ordered Mexican pizza.
Crest was thin and cheese was just sticky and yummy. Fresh pizza. Taste was also well blended.

Had port wine and peoples beer.

Service was instant.
Atmosphere was nice.
Not much crowded.

Restroom was also available and was okay.
